review: Super easy to setup, and works great after a couple days of having it.** UPDATE **I've had this now for quite a few months and have been very happy with it.  I actually have two of them.  Use it for Netflix, AmazonPrime, SlingTV, Hulu most of the time.
author: Nicholas Pickhard

review: great product. Works as advertised and use it when I travel too saving me the hassle of lugging along a big fire tv unit :)
author: Sanjay M.

review: Had some problems with remote when setting up.  I like the ease to switch between  TV's.  Could use more instruction for selecting the Netflix service.  We were Netflix subscribers prior to buying the Fire Stcik but had no idea how to use the service when we connected the Fire Stick.
author: Colin Ponder

review: So far very happy!!!  Works like a charm and setup was a breeze!!!  You just have to remember to not have a brain freeze and go into tv settings when you're done watching the show and reverse the HDMI and Component settings!!!!  It's still easy tho!!!!  Who needs Hulu or Netflix or the others.....they all seem to be offering the same diet!!!  If you have Amazon Prime the Fire TV Stick is a no-brainer!!
author: Amazon Customer

review: Thought I would be able to use it in Hotels with wifi... but there is no browser page to connect.  That was the only thing I was going to use it for since I travel all the time. But now I will have to get Chrome cast. And use my computer with hdmi to watch things on Amazon since Amazon will not work it out with Chrome cast to let them use their amazon prime app!  Something has got to change... either Amazon gives them their app or comes up with something better themselves.
author: Jacob

review: Wifi is the drawback. Stick receives 5 out of 5 bars consistently. 20' from router 1 interior wall between them. But why the buffering. Content is fantastic though. Wifi signal is strong in my house. I have a few devices that all operate well. Fire Stick continues to Buffer and Buffer. Unusable! I will try Fire TV with Ethernet connection.
